This is Lucy’s first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more green maize, tomatoes and bananas. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open another grocery store and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more green maize, tomatoes and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Tillobat

texts.ru: Опытная портниха из Таджикистана нуждается в вашей доброте. Ее зовут Тиллобат и она создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Ей 56  лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет  3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 15 лет назад она начала свой бизнес. Она работает в ателье в центре города. Ее дочь помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  10000 сомони для покупки новой швейной машинки и тканей для шитья новых платьев. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
An experienced dressmaker from Tajikistan needs your kindness. Her name is Tillobat and the Tajikistani national dresses that she creates are true masterpieces.

Tillobat is 56 years old, divorced, and is raising 3 children. She started her business 15 years ago in order to provide for her family's needs. She works in a sewing studio in the city center. Her daughter helps her in her business. Thanks to the good service Tillobat gives her customers, she has a large clientele. 

Tillobat needs to purchase a new sewing machine but she can't afford to buy one with the income she earns. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 10,000 Tajikistan Somoni in order to buy a sewing machine and fabric to sew new dresses. She hopes that you can assist her.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 29-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 9 years. He describes himself to be a focused man. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are residents from the neighborhood. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes for resale. His business goal is to buy clothes for increasing his business stock over the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man who operates a motorcycle taxi. He is taking care of five children, all in school, and has worked in this business for two years. He remarks that his job is very difficult because during the winter he has a lot of obstacles because he has fewer passengers since it's cold. His dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus progress every day.

Tsuma is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a person with a great sense of responsibility, having established his own grocery store three years ago in his house to provide an income for his family.

James believes the Kiva loans are a good option because getting a bank or financial institution loan is very difficult due to the many documents and guarantees required.

The loan James is requesting is to expand his business so he can better attend to his customers and increase his earnings, thereby offering all of his family a better quality of life since they all depend on him. He plans to use this loan to add stock of wheat flour, rice, sugar, and snacks.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, rice, sugar, and snacks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with five children. She has been in the cereals business for the last ten years earning approximately KES.10,000 monthly. 

This is Elizabeth’s second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She borrowed KES.50,000 and plans to use it for purchasing dry maize and beans for resale. 

With the anticipated profits she plans to invest back into her business. She hopes to venture into horticulture.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en: Omari, 45, is a married man with six children who are all attending school. He works buying and selling goats that are then slaughtered. He buys his goats from different markets in the rural areas and sells them to the slaughterhouses in the city of Mombasa, Kenya. He is applying for the loan to buy a greater number of goats because he had an offer that he wants to take advantage of.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of goats.

loans.name: Tone

texts.en:
Tone is forty-five and has five children, and all of them live in northeast Albania. Two of her children are still attending school. Tone has been helped financially and otherwise from the Area Development Projects of World Vision Albania and she is very grateful for all the help. For the past twenty years Tone has been involved with livestock, raising goats and making delicious goat cheese.

Lately she was also chosen to participate in the value chain project that is a collaboration between World Vision Albania and VisionFund Albania. She wants to buy thirty goats. Based on the business plan that she has been presented with, she can employ others, too, if everything goes as planned.

Tone hopes that lenders at Kiva will help her to achieve her goal by lending to her.

loans.use: To buy thirty goats.

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has had a business of selling clothing for over five years; this is how she supports her household. This enterprising woman wants to make an investment buying clothing to increase her stock of the merchandise she sells. For this Naome has trusted in Yehu, the intermediary institution between Kiva and herself, to get her first loan. With this she plans to get greater profits, because with a greater selection she can attract a larger clientele.

The lack of capital and growth opportunities has been a big obstacle for this woman. Thanks to Kiva and Yehu, Naome not only will have a loan, but she also will be able to get training and advice in such a way that she will have sustainable growth.

loans.use: to buy clothing to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: La Masheñita Paxot Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa, esta casada, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica ala tejeduría de guipiles y sute, inicio este negocio gracias apoyo de su madre y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien presta sus servicios de jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, para aumentar su producción de guipiles y sutes (suter son sabanas para llenar bebes o puede ser servilletas también cuando son pequeñas), espera mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la tejeduría y al comercio.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 31 year old married woman who didn't have the chance to go to school. She has 1 son who is in school and works weaving  huipiles and sute [articles of traditional clothing]. She started this business thanks to her mother's support and so far, she has 10 years experience. She has the support of her husband, who is a laborer. 

The group organized the loan to use to buy different colors and types of thread to increase production of huipiles and sutes (sutes are wraps to swaddle babies or they can also be used as napkins when they are small). She hopes to improve her business and her income. The other members work as weavers and merchants.

loans.use: to buy thread to make huipiles and sutes

loans.name: Soriba

texts.en:
This is 24 year-old Soriba.  He is single and has no children. In 2007, Soriba established his textiles business. He began his business just after he completed high school. As he did not have the opportunity to pursue his education, he thus went into business. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business.

Soriba would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy one bail of jeans and to use the remaining amount to pay for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 900,000 SLL.

In the future, Soriba plans to rent a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bail of jeans for resale and to pay transport costs.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité San Vicente gracias al trabajo que hacen sus miembros ya está en el segundo ciclo, tienen como meta crecer y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias y también ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Maria es parte de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de sábanas, naranjas y miel de caña de azúcar,  esto gracias al crédito que se le otorgó, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico, es por ello que solicita la ayuda de kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de sabanas y naranjas, para que así pueda seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Thanks to the job of its members, the San Vicente Committee is already working its second cycle. Their goal is to grow professionally in order to support their families as well as to help each other out.
Maria is a member of this group. She engages in selling sheets, oranges and molasses. She says that thanks to the loan she has received she has been able to improve her activity as well as her standard of living and her economic income. For this reason she is asking Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for their support: she will buy sheets and oranges so that she will be able to keep on working and supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy sheets and oranges.

loans.name: Mahuklo 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est marié  un maçon du nom de Fulbert. Madeleine est mère de six enfants dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à la charge du couple. Madeleine vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près d’une vingtaine d’année que Madeleine mène comme activité la vente du maïs et des charbons de bois à son domicile. Madeleine mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Madeleine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits
texts.en:
Mahuklo 2 is a group of 3 people, whose members all lives in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Madeleine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 52 years old and married to a builder called Fulbert. Madeleine is the mother of 6 children, some of whom attend school and two of whom are still dependent on the couple. Madeleine lives together with her children and her husband. The couple both take care of the various expenses.

Madeleine did not go to school. She has been selling corn and firewood from her home for nearly 20 years. Madeleine does this so that she is able to meet the household needs. She gets her supplies in her area and in a town in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Madeleine is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of Mahuklo 2. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi, 35, is a fish monger in Mombasa. She is the widowed mother of two children, aged seven and ten years. She ventured into this business seven years ago and it is doing great.

She is requesting a second loan from KADET Ltd. Sidi plans to use the loan to purchase more Tilapia, Nile perch fish and sardines to resell to her customers.

The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stock of fish and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more Tilapia, Nile perch fish and sardines.

loans.name: Turwanyubujuju Group

texts.fr:
Léa  fait partie du groupe  Turwanyubujuju  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a  52 ans et est mariée à  Déo, un commerçant de bière de banane. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, dont 4   étudient.
Elle prend soin d’un enfant.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis  25ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes pour préparer une grande quantité de bière de banane,  à vendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Léa is part of the Turwanyubujuju group, and lives in Gitega. She is 52 years of age and married to Déo, who sells banana beer. Together they have six children, four of whom are at school. Léa looks after one child, and has worked selling banana beer for 25 years.

This is Léa’s 11th loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she has applied for, she will increase her capital and buy a lot of bananas, so that she can prepare a large quantity of banana beer to sell and earn more.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy a lot of bananas, so that she can prepare a large quantity of banana beer to sell and earn more.

loans.name: Luce

texts.en:
Luce is in her early forties and is the mother of five, her oldest child being twenty and youngest being eight. All of her children attend school. As she has a family with five children, she has received financial help from World Vision Albania’s Economic Area Development. “I would not be where I am today without their help. I see progress with my children. They go to school now when they would not otherwise and I’m happy,”” Luce said.

Luce has been selected recently to participate in the Economic Development Program from World Vision Albania and the microfinance of VisionFund Albania to expand her business. She has earned the technical skills and through the project she is now learning the entrepreneurial basic skills that will help her in developing and sustaining her business.

Luce is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy thirty goats and hopes that lenders will show some understanding.

loans.use: to buy thirty goats to expand her business.

loans.name: Oluwatobi 3 Group

texts.fr: OLUWATOBI 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Véronique Bibiré (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 61 ans et est mariée à un certain Jérôme. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Véronique Bibiré et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Véronique Bibiré n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de vingt ans que Véronique Bibiré mène comme activité la vente de divers accessoires de sauce (condiments, épices). Véronique Bibiré exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Véronique Bibiré s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Véronique Bibiré sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWATOBI 3. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Oluwatobi 3 is a group of 3 people, whose members are friends who live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Véronique Bibiré (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 61 years old and married to Jérôme. The couple have 6 children, all of whom attend, or have attended, school, and one of whom is still dependent on them. Véronique Bibiré and her husband live their child and the couple both take care of the various household responsibilities.

Véronique Bibiré did not go to school. She has been selling various ingredients with which to make sauce (condiments and spices) for nearly 20 years. Véronique Bibiré works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies in her area. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Véronique Bibiré is requesting a 3rd loan, together with the other members of Oluwatobi 3. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments and spices.

loans.name: Sohoueto 2 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 2 est un groupement de trente cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sosthène Théophilia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Sosthène Théophilia et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de leur enfant. Sosthène Théophilia a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Il y a cinq ans environs que Sosthène Théophilia exerce comme activité principale, la coiffure dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sosthène Théophilia vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux. Sosthène Théophilia exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Sosthène Théophilia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Sosthène Théophilia sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Sohoueto 2 is a group of 35 people, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Sosthène Théophilia (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 36 years of age. She is married to Thomas, and the couple has two children, one at school and under the care of the couple. 

Sosthène Théophilia and her husband live with their child, and together ensure that the child’s various needs are met. Sosthène Théophilia finished her education during elementary school, and now works as a hairdresser in her salon as her main business. In addition, she also sells hair extensions and hair products. She is passionate about this business, and it allows her to provide for herself and her children. 

Sosthène Théophilia buys her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, and with the aim of increasing her working capital, she has requested her first loan along with the other members of the Sohoueto 2 group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ requests, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila is in the mid forties and married. She is a mother of two and lives in south east Albania. Her primary source of income for the last 6 years has been raising livestock. This activity suits her caring and animal lover personality and is profitable enough to make her a living as well.

Currently, Anila has three cows and has been selling cheese and butter to locals. The cheese she makes in not very salty and not very greasy either, because she takes way the fat before she makes it. Anila has a very steady clientele and many people in the region, who suffer from diabetes, prefer her cheese because it is homemade and low-fat.

Anila would like to add some more cows to her livestock with the loan she is requesting from Kiva. She wants to thank all of the lenders. This is not Anila’s first loan. It’s the fifth one, and all the previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Mahudo Group

texts.fr: MAHUDO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Clautilde (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un marchand du nom de Paul. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Clautilde et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Clautilde a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Clautilde mène comme activité la vente des ustensiles de cuisine, du riz et des savons de façon ambulante. Clautilde exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Clautilde s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Clautilde sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Mahudo is a group of 3 people, whose members are friends living in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Clautilde (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 24 years old and married to a merchant called Paul. The couple have 3 dependent children, some of whom attend school. Clautilde and her husband live together with their children and the couple both take care of the children's various expenses.

Clautilde left school at secondary level. She has been selling kitchen utensils, rice and soaps on the street for nearly 5 years. Clautilde works intensely, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies in her region. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Clautilde is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of Mahudo. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en:
Aferdita is in her late forties and is married, with two children, who attend school.  They are Egyptians from the vulnerable ethnic minority of south eastern Albania, and they live in a beautiful little town next to the shore.  Aferdita is very proud of her children attending school, something that is not very usual in her community. 

For the past three years, she has been operating a little business of her own, repairing clothes for residents in her town.  The beginning was very difficult she claims, yet lately, it has picked up and now she wants to employ her niece as well.  People in her town speak very highly of her.

Aferdita is applying for a loan to add one more sewing machine, hoping that she will be helped by Kiva lenders.  In return she promises them that she will pay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Camillia dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans. Camillia est mariée à un certain Brice. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Camillia n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de dix huit ans que Camillia mène comme activité la vente des articles de quincaillerie dans son quartier. Camillia exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Camillia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Camillia sollicite un troisième crédit avec le second membre du groupe MISSIMIDE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Missimide is a group of 2 people, whose members live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Camillia (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 49 years old and married to Brice. The couple have 4 dependent children, some of whom attend school. The couple live with the children and both take care of the various household needs.

Camillia did not go to school. She has been selling hardware items in her district for nearly 18 years. Camillia works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Camillia is requesting a 3rd loan, together with the second member of Missimide. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hardware items.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is fifty one, married and has two children who are presently attending school. They all live in the south of Albania.  Artur has been a sole financial provider for his family of 4, for almost 12 years.  Since they live in the city, there is a scarcity of jobs, which is why his wife hasn’t found any job, even though she is educated.

Feeling financially strapped for some time, Artur decided to open a bar-café three years ago.  An initial loan helped him start this business. Then, he applied for more loans to buy inventory and other necessary items for the cafe.  Kindly note, that he has been very good at paying all the previous loans.

Artur is now applying for another loan to renovate the inside of the bar-cafe.  He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their kindness and lend to him.

loans.use: To renovate the inside of an old bar-cafe

loans.name: Girineza Group

texts.fr:
Goreth  fait partie du groupe  Girineza et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a  31 ans et est mariée à Désiré,un menuisier. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 4 à 8ans.

Elle fait le commerce des habits   depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Goreth is part of the Girineza group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 31 years old is married to Désiré, a carpenter. Together, the couple have 3 children, aged between 4 and 8.

Goreth has been selling clothes for 4 years. This will be her second loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a lot of clothes for resale, so that she can earn more.

loans.use: to buy a lot of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba makes kenkey (sourdough dumplings) to sell. She is showing the soaked corn, which will be washed and milled into dough for the kenkey at Abura. 

Aba uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more corn to prepare kenkey (sourdough dumplings) to sell

loans.name: Akouegnon 2 Group

texts.fr: AKOUEGNON 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Martine Edwige Sènami (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée. Martine Edwige Sènami et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a quelque années que Martine Edwige Sènami exerce comme activité, divers produits et des cartes de recharge dans son quartier. Martine Edwige Sènami exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Martine Edwige Sènami s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Martine Edwige Sènami sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AKOUEGNON 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Akouegnon 2 is a group with three members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Martine Edwige Sènami (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 39 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and children, with the couple ensuring that the various household expenses are covered. 

For several years Martine Edwige Sènami has worked selling various products and telephone refill cards in her neighborhood. She is passionate about this business, and it allows her to provide for herself and her children. She gets her supplies in a market located in Benin. 

To ensure customer satisfaction and with the aim of increasing her working capital, Martine Edwige Sènami has requested her first loan, alongside the other members of the Akouegnon 2 group. This loan will help them to better meet their customers’ requests, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy various products and telephone refill cards.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is 50, married, and has one child who is eighteen years old.  Her husband, who worked in the military for years, was recently laid off and there are no other job openings in his field.

Bukurije has been working as a waitress in a nearby restaurant for the past three years.   At the same time, she has been selling milk and other dairy products to the locals and the restaurant where she works.  She has only one milk cow at the moment and wants to add one more from a good breed to increase the income.

She has no money saved and this is the reason she is requesting a Kiva loan.  Bukurije has repaid two other loans that she had requested in the past.  She hopes that she will receive financial help from the kind Kiva lenders and wants to thank them.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia cooks banku (cooked fermented corn dough) to sell at Asebu near Cape Coast. She serves her banku with fried fish and vegetable sauce. 

Cecilia is marrried and has two children. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. 

Cecilia will use her loan to purchase maize for her banku, fish, and vegetables for her sauce. With the new profit, Cecilia wishes to set up a stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: purchase maize for her banku, fish and vegetables for her sauce

loans.name: Ste Trinite Group

texts.fr: STE TRINITE est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette Pélagie dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Antoinette Pélagie est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Philippe. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Antoinette Pélagie a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Antoinette Pélagie mène comme activité la vente des cartes de recharges, des friandises et de l’huile végétale. Antoinette Pélagie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Antoinette Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Antoinette Pélagie sollicite un quatrième crédit avec le second membre du groupe STE TRINITE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Ste Trinite is a group of two people, who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative is called Antoinette Pélagie (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 34 years of age. She is married to a teacher called Philippe, and the couple has two dependent children who are at school. The family lives together, and the couple makes sure that the various household expenses are covered. 

Antoinette Pélagie did not go to school for very long. For almost 15 years she has worked selling refill cards, candies and vegetable oil. She is passionate about this business, and it allows her to provide for herself. She gets her supplies in a market located in Benin. 

In order to ensure customer satisfaction, Antoinette Pélagie has requested a fourth loan with the other member of the Ste Trinite group. This loan will allow them to better meet the needs of their customers, as well as to make more profits. Their previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy telephone refill cards, candies and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works diligently to earn a living. She is married and has three children. Her spouse is a farmer and tricycle driver within her local community. 

Cristina is runs a general store. Aside from this, she also has a fishpond and corn field. Cristina has been a good a borrower for three years. Her aim in life is to have a better way of living. She would like to expand her offerings so her customers will no longer go to other general stores just to buy their basic necessities.

She has requested another loan of PHP20,000. She will be using this to buy additional merchandise, which will enable her to satisfy demand. In this way, she will obtain higher profits, which will serve her family's needs, the development of her corn field and the improvement of her fishpond.

In the picture, she is wearing a white shirt while the project officer wears a blue uniform.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Yolande Vanina

texts.fr: Yolande est une jeune femme agée de 25ans, célibataire sans enfants. Elle a 03 personne en charge qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale où elle vend des téléphones portables et accessoires depuis 09 mois. Son dynamisme et son acceuil chaleureux lui ont valu une clientèle considérable quelle a du mal a satisfaire à cause de la rupture permanante des stocks. Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'étendre son activité et subvenir aux besoins et à l'éducation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yolande is a young, 25-year-old woman, who is single and has no children. She has three people dependent on her, who go to school. She has worked for the past nine months selling cellphones and accessories in a neighborhood in the capital. Her dynamic nature and warm welcome have enabled her to build up a considerable customer base, which she has difficulty satisfying due to constant stock shortages. 

Yolande has requested a loan to increase her stock of merchandise, so that she can satisfy her numerous customers. The profits generated will allow her to expand her business, as well as to provide for her family’s needs and education.

loans.use: To buy telephones and accessories.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a business-oriented woman. She is 33, married, and has only one child. Teresa has been running her home-based general store for seven years. She is thankful to God because she is blessed with a loving and supportive husband.

Teresa has been a borrower for three years. Aside from her home-based store, she also offers frozen foods and street foods. She enjoys running her home-based store because she is able to earn bigger profits. Her profits were used for their daily needs, improvement of her street food business, buying and selling charcoal, and some was used to purchase her tricycle as an investment. 

She is really grateful because through this financial support she has been able to make her business grow. Now she would like to increase the volume of her merchandise, so she is requesting another loan of PHP20,000. She hopes she can continue to improve her store so she can earn better profits, which will enable her to provide her child with a higher level of education and to enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a hog raiser within her local community. She has been in this field for three years. Her main goal is to raise her hogs properly so that she can obtain a better income.

She is married and has two children. Her spouse is a farmer. The couple works hard to have enough income and have a better way of living. 

Leticia's previous loan was used to improve her livestock business. Leticia struggles for more capital because of the high cost of livestock feed. She is asking for a loan of PHP25,000, allowing her to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines.Through this loan, she can ensure the proper growth of her hogs. She hopes that this amount will be granted.

In the picture, the client is shown with the project officer.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is married and has only one child who currently goes to school.

Rosal has raised hogs since March 2012. She is happy because although she is quite busy with her insurance job, she is still able to manage her hog-raising business.

Rosal aims to educate her child and increase her profits so she can improve her family's living conditions. Rosal would like to apply for a loan of PHP 25,000. This would allow her to buy three piglets and hog feed. She hopes that her business continues to grow and that she will be able to obtain her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and hog feed for her raised hogs.

loans.name: Zelia

texts.en:
Zelia is 28 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. She is taking a loan of $1,000 to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including coffee, oil, kerosene, sugar and salt.  

Zelia started her business in 2006 with working capital of $500. She has land on which she cultivates coffee, corn, sweet potatoes and pineapple. She hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies, including coffee, kerosene, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida is 43 years old and married with six children. She and her husband work hard in order to earn a living.

Zoraida has operated her general store for one year and she also spent 20 years vending frozen foods. She is glad because her previous loan has had a great impact in the development of her businesses. At this time, she aims to expand her general store business and increase her profits. In this way, she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions and educate her children.

Zoraida would like to ask for additional working capital in the amount of PHP 9,000, which will be used to buy merchandise for her to satisfy her customers' demands. She hopes to obtain this loan so she can make all her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Eliza is 42 years old and has 10 children, seven of whom are in school. Her husband is a business man. Eliza herself became involved in business activities in 2011, using her own working capital of $200. Eliza has a coffee farm as well as a kiosk in front of her house. She is taking out a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies for her kiosk, including cigarettes, candles, oil, books, pens and rice.

loans.use: to buy goods for her kiosk, such as cigarettes, candles, oil, books, pens and rice.

loans.name: Helia

texts.en:
Helia is 40 years old and married with three children. Her eldest child is in senior high school now.  Her husband is a security guard. 

Helia has a kiosk where she sells general store items. With the loan, she will purchase additional items for her store, including noodles, eggs, candles, detergent and oil. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with working capital of $150. She has a farm on which she grows bananas, corn and sweet potatoes. She wants her business to grow bigger in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, including noodles, eggs, candles, detergent and oil.

loans.name: Filipa

texts.en: Filipa is requesting a loan to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including sugar, coffee, oil, candles and rice. There are five members in the family: Filipa, her three children and her husband. She has been doing business since 2009 with her own working capital of $500. She has just enough land to build a house. She wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, oil, candles and rice.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a 50-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her eldest is 26 and her youngest is 6 years old. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for 12 years. She sells basic commodities like snack food, toiletries, seasonings and canned goods. She usually earns a profit of 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, seasonings, toiletries, condiments and chips to add to her inventory. This will help boost her customers' patronage and increase her income. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and a better supply of merchandise to earn a better profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, seasonings, toiletries, condiments and chips to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many items (beans, rice, salt,...) to resell in her shop in order to earn more money

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 54-year-old married man and father of five children; he is spending his whole life for their sake. Ahmad loves his family a lot and works hard to fulfill their needs.

He has 35 years of experience working in the mechanics field He has a very good reputation because of his special mechanical talent and customer care.

Ahmad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for 12 consecutive cycles. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his social and financial situations.

Today Ahmad's requested Al Majmoua loan will be invested in helping his son to continue building his house. He is planning to help all of his children in making their dreams come true as much as he can. 

He hopes to stay healthy and capable of working to see all of his children married and happy.

loans.use: to help his son continue building his house.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is 39 years old. She is married, and she has five children, four of whom are in school. She has a kiosk in front of her house. To improve her kiosk, she is requesting a loan to buy needed items to keep in her kiosk. She opened her kiosk a year ago. She lives in her simple house with her family. She hopes to build a good house and make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, books, pens and rice.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is single. She is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. Mary Joy is a farmer, and she operates a gardening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years, and every month she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Mary Joy has been a member of GDMPC since just this year. In the future, Mary Joy hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Carlos Lizandro

texts.es:
Don Carlos tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, a sembrar maíz y fríjol, fue su padrastro quien le enseño; a los 18 años de edad, se independizo a trabajar lo propio. Los productos que necesita los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a cinco minutos de su casa y los transporta en moto- taxi desde la tienda hasta su casa, luego los carga en su espalda durante una hora para llegar al lugar donde tiene sus cultivos. 

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de tres arrobas de semilla de fríjol, tres sacos de abono, pesticidas para cultivar 10,500 metros cuadrados de terreno. Con la inversión él espera obtener una mejor cosecha para que sus ganancias sean mayores.
texts.en:
Don Carlos is 64, married, and has two children. He has always made a living through agriculture by planting corn and beans.  It was his stepfather who taught him; at 18 years of age he became independent to work on his own.  The products he needs he acquires in a city that is five minutes from his home, and he transports them in a motorcycle taxi from the store to his house.  Later he carries them on his back for an hour in order to take them to the place where he has his crops.

He will use the loan to buy three twenty-five pound units of bean seed, three sacks of fertilizer, and pesticides to cultivate 10,500 square meters of land.  With the investment he hopes to get a better harvest so that his earnings are greater.

loans.use: to buy three twenty-five pound units of bean seed, three sacks of fertilizer, and pesticides to cultivate 10,500 square meters of land.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Mirian tiene 44 años de edad, tiene una hija. Ella posee una moto-taxi desde hace tres años y una tienda desde hace dos años. El trabajo lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, al ver la necesidad en su comunidad. Los productos que necesita los adquiere en su mayoría en los camiones repartidores a los cuales les realiza los pedidos y la otra parte la compra en una ciudad que esta a cinco minutos de su casa y los transporta en moto- taxi hasta su casa.  

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de piedra, cemento, hierro, pago de mano de obra para construir un muro perimetral en su casa. De esta forma su hogar, estará más seguro ya que por el momento no cuenta ni con cerco de alambre. Así, ella podrá invertir más en su tienda; pues tendrá confianza en que su casa este más segura sin temor a que le puedan robar sus productos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 44 years old, and she has a daughter.  She has had a ‘moto-taxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle] for three years and a store for two years. She learned the work on her own initiative upon seeing the need in her community.

She gets the products that she needs mostly from the orders she places with distribution trucks.  She buys the other part in a city that is five minutes from her house, and she takes them by moto-taxi to her house.

She will use the loan to buy stone, cement, and iron and to pay for the labor to build a perimeter wall around her house.  This way her home will be safer;  now she does not even have a wire fence.  This way she will be able to invest more in her store.  She will be confident that her house is safer, and she will not be afraid of having her products stolen.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, and iron and to pay for the labor to build a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married and has seven children. She is 39 years old and 2 of her children are in school. Letecia is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her business. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business. Lydia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Fanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Ma. Fanie works hard to support her family. She has a crab vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ma. Fanie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional crabs to sell for her crab vending business.

Ma. Fanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
Rosefina is a 50-year old resident of Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She provides for her 3 children from the little amount of PHP 8,000 she earns monthly from her own piggery business, which she has been running for 2 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. However, since 2010 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan with GDMPC micro finance of PHP 15,000 to buy feeding supplies. 

Rosefina wants to make expansions to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Elena is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal necessary ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 33 years old and married. She has 3 children.

Maribeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maribeth has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maribeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her business. Mila has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and selling fermented shrimps.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 69 years old and married. She has 3 children. Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair) retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair) retail business for 30 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jielez

texts.en:
Jielez is married and has 4 child. She is 37 years old and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

Jielez provides catering services to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Every month she earns PHP 8,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. This year, she joined GDMPC. 

In the future, Jielez hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 29 years old and lives in the commuinity of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages 4, 8 and 10. Her husband works as a driver to provide income for their needs. She helps by operating a Sari-sari store, a business that she has been operating for two years now. She sells basic commodities like soap, seasoning, canned goods, chips and toiletries. She is optimistic to keep on improving her business for the sake of her family.

Marilou is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies of canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasonings. The profit from the sale of these good will help to pay for her children's school fees and to provide nutritious food.

In the future, Mariloou hopes to have a better store and business location for an increased profit.

loans.use: to buy

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 35 years old and married. She has three children. With 2 children in school, Susana works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Susana has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, snack foods, etc.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela  tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos viven  en estados unidos, su hijo menor estudia séptimo grado. Ella esta muy feliz con su familia, es unida con valores y principios. Su esposo trabaja en una ferretería de la ciudad, se levanta a las  3:30 a.m. para abordar el autobús y regresa a su casa a las 6:00 p.m. es muy luchador y trabajador. Desde la edad de los siete años Estela, aprendió a ahilar y a elaborar lazos. Le ayudaba a sus padres, para ganarse el pan de cada día junto a su familia; a la edad de 27 años se dedico a realizar los oficios domésticos y se caso.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 800 tejas, que le ayude al mejoramiento de su casa. Así, reparara el techo de su casa, debido a que la temporada lluviosa esta bastante fuerte;  así estarán más seguros. Su deseo es instalar una granja de pollos y gallinas ponedoras, continuar trabajando con la fundación y apoyar siempre a su familia.
texts.en:
Estela is 50 years of age, married, and has three children. Two of her children live in the USA, and her youngest son is in the seventh grade. Estela is very happy with her family, which is united by its values and principles. Her husband works in a hardware store in the city, and gets up at 3:30 am to catch the bus. He comes home at 6 pm, and is very determined and hardworking. 

At the age of 7 Estela started to learn how to weave and make rope. She helped her parents, and earned a living for herself alongside her family. When she turned 27 she started to carry out domestic work, and got married.

Estela has requested this loan from Fundación Campo to buy 800 tiles, as this will help her to make improvements to her house. She will repair the roof on her home, as the rainy season is fairly strong, and this will allow her family to be safer. Her dream is to set up a farm with chickens and laying hens, to continue working with the Foundation, and to always be able to support her family.

loans.use: To buy 800 tiles to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 49 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Rosalie runs a nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Rosalie has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Veronica works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling of mad crabs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and fishing. Veronica is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell for her business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of buildng and expanding her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal crabs to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 60 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Jesusa has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jesusa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her business. Rhoda has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.

Rhoda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. She is a widow and has 4 children. 

To make a living, Marianita owns and operates a business selling slippers and shoes. She been in this business for 21 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month. Marianita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase new items so she can expand the range of goods that she sells. 

In 2008, Marianita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items so she can expand the range of goods that she sells.

loans.name: Elia Hermenegilda

texts.es:
La señora Elia  tiene 58 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Desde hace 32 años que ella trabaja, empezó realizando los oficios domésticos, luego aprendió en el negocio de una tienda de sus hermanos a administrarla. 

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de lociones, medicamentos, bebidas, ropa, jabones, churros, productos de la canasta básica y mobiliario para la tienda. Con el préstamo pagara la compra de la mercadería, ya que antes se la vendían para pagar al mes pero le salía más cara. Ella, espera que sus ingresos mejoren, para que a su familia no le falte la alimentación, vivienda y salud. Su objetivo, es mejor constantemente su negocio; para recibir buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Elia is 58 years old and has a son.  She has worked for 32 years; she began by doing household chores and then later learned to manage the business of her brothers' store.

She will use the loan to buy lotions, medicines, drinks, clothing, soap, churros, and basic food and home-furnishing items for the store.  With the loan she will pay for the purchase of the merchandise since before they sold it in order to pay monthly, but it came out to be more expensive.  

She hopes her income will improve so that her family will not lack food, housing, and health.  Her goal is to constantly improve her business in order to receive a better income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, medicines, drinks, clothing, soap, churros, and basic food and home-furnishing items for the store.

loans.name: Gloria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, una hija de 24 años y dos varones uno de 18 y otro de 15 años. Ella se dedica a la sastrería, oficio que aprendió en un taller impartido en su comunidad y su mamá era sastra y también le enseño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una pila para almacenar agua, ya que hace poco tiempo en su comunidad instalaron el servicio de agua potable y se le esta haciendo urgente construir la pila para no desperdiciar el agua, ya que se vera reflejada en le recibo que tiene que pagar mes a mes por el servicio.
texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old. She is married and has three children: a 24 year old daughter and two sons, 18 and 15. She is a seamstress, a profession she learned at a workshop given in her community. Her mother was a seamstress and taught her as well. 

The loan she has asked Fundación Campo for is to build a cistern to save water in, since a short time ago they started offering potable water in her community. It is urgent to build the cistern so she doesn't waste any water, since the water will show up on the recepit she pays every month.

loans.use: to build a cistern to store water.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: As a widowed parent of two children, Rosario works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothing. Rosario is borrowing PHP10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business. Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She has had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy enough items to meet people's needs. 

However, after receiving information about Tuba Rai Metin, Teresa is very interested in requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more needed items to keep in her store.
 
Teresa has two children to look after. None of her children are in school; they are all underage. Her husband is very helpful in her business because he is also a businessman. She lives in her simple house made of bricks and zinc for a roof. She wants to make her kiosk like a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, biscuits and rice.

loans.name: Buena Nueva Group

texts.es:
El comité Buena Nueva esta integrado por seis personas, el grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre los compañeros; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras. La mayoría de los integrantes son indígenas.Los  integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Jóvenes.
El comité Buena Nueva, quedo muy conforme por el respaldo económico otorgado de la Fundación Paraguaya por ser la empresa que ha depositado en ellas la confianza y les dio la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida  a través del trabajo y la integración grupal.
Ageda, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la cría de animales, los cuida, los alimenta, y luego los pone a la venta generando así ingresos para ella y su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y gastos de veterinaria para estos. En la foto del grupo aparecen tanto los miembros del grupo como sus padres  demás personas, ya que son un grupo muy querido por todos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Buena Nueva consists of six people. The group began by showing unity and solidarity among its members, who have business activities and are very hard-working. The majority of the members are indigenous. The members already had businesses before forming part of the youth committee.

The Buena Nueva group is very compliant with the economic support granted by Fundación Paraguaya for being the organization that has placed confidence in them and given them the opportunity to improve their quality of life through work and group membership.

Ageda, one of the members of the group, raises animals. She cares for them and feeds them, and later puts them up for sale, thus generating income for her and her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals and pay veterinary expenses for them. In the group photo there are the group members as well as their parents, since the members are well-loved by everyone.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten animals.

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Solución” tiene 10 integrantes de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son mujeres que día a día se esfuerza por salir adelante y superarse, el objetivo de cada una es dejar atrás las necesidades y ser mejores.
Rita, la presidenta, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, comenta que es muy sacrificado, ya que es un trabajo de tiempo completo. Su sueño es poder tener una gran granja llena de animales y de esa forma seguir trabajando.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados, con lo cual podrá seguir alimentando a sus animales y cuidándoles de esa forma.
texts.en:
The community bank “La Solución” is made up of 10 members from the city of Santaní.  These are women who make an effort every day to get ahead and better themselves.  Every member has the same goal: to cover her basic necessities and keep improving.

Rita, the president, has a business raising and selling animals.  She says that this takes a great deal of sacrifice, since it is a job that requires all of one's time.  Her dream is to be able to have a large farm full of animals and keep working in this business.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy feed, so that she can continue to feed and care for her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres de Caacupe se unieron con el fin de formar un grupo solidario y de esa forma y luchando contra las necesidades. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
Salvadora forma parte del grupo, ella es modista y comenta que siempre fue muy emprendedora y que desde muy joven trabajo. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, a que sus clientes siempre quedan conformes con su trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Sixteen women of Caacupe joined together with the goal of forming a communal bank and in this way to strive against adversities. They are very hard-working and entrepreneurial women.

Salvadora is part of this group. She is a dressmaker and comments that she was always very entrepreneurial and has worked since she was very young. She says that she has very good customers and that they are always satisfied with her work.

She is applying for the loan to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, fasteners and other supplies to be able to continue working and advancing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, fasteners, and other supplies

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité "El Progreso"se originó a traves de promociones que se hicieron en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar,fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra. Estanilaa es la Presidenta del grupo, ella actualmente es ama de casa pero está emprendiendo en la venta de ropa, su deseo es trabajar en la venta de ropa en forma independiente, ella pondra el mayor esfuerzo para que su comité surja  y salga adelante,asi podra ejecutar su idea y plan de trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá empezar a trabajar y de esa forma atraer a la clientela. Agradece por la oportunidad que Kiva y fundación paraguaya les está dando.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Progreso" (Progress) originated from classes that were done in the neighborhood.  All of the members are acquaintances and neighbors from the same area.  The goal of each of the women is to work, to form a spirit of solidarity, and to achieve the maximum level of the program.  

Estanilaa is the president of the group.  Currently she is a housewife, but she is beginning to sell clothing, and her desire is to sell it independently.  Estanilaa will give the utmost effort so that her group progresses and succeeds.  This is how she will be able to execute her business plan.  

Estanilaa is applying for this loan to buy garments of all types which will allow her to begin working and attracting customers.  She is thankful for the opportunity given to her by Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase garments for retail.

loans.name: Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité “Joaju” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas ellas trabajan juntas, es por ello que el grupo lleva por nombre Joaju, que significa unión.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales, con lo cual ayudan a sus hijos y familiares a salir adelante. Es un trabajo muy duro, pero ellas lo hacen por el bien de sus familias.
Felicia, la presidenta, solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, con lo cual podrá seguir alimentando a sus animales,.
texts.en:
A few women coming from the town of Santaní have joined forces to form the “Joaju” Committee. They all work together in the town of Santaní and for this reason they have chosen to name the group Joaju, meaning “union”.
They all engage in breeding and selling animals, an activity thanks to which they help providing for their children and relatives. It is a very hard job, but they do it for the wellbeing of their families.
Felicia is the president, and she is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals, thus succeeding in feeding them.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: La Buena Union 4 Group

texts.en:
Leonor is one of the members of the La Buena Unión (The Good Union) 4. They are micro entrepreneurs who are in clothing sales, sales of assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

She lives in a simple home structure with her long-term partner. She says her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business and improve it. From the beginning, it was very hard for her because she didn't have the capital for it.

Leonor is very excited about receiving her fifth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward her business’s growth. She has had her business for about five years; she has been taking out loans from Esperanza for about four years. She will use this new loan to buy shoes in different sizes and styles. She will use profits to reinvest in her business and to save. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia  is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon in Batanya near Cape Coast. She is married with three children.  Emelia  has been a hairdresser for a year now.  She uses her income to support her husband and to pay their utility bills. Emelia will use her loan to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase  creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer  for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza de sesenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su hija, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, huevos, leche, pan, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en el lugar donde reside y sus mayores clientes son los vecinos, y las personas que llegan a una cancha cercana los fines de semana, la prefieren porque su tienda es la mas surtida siempre encuentran lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a buenos precios pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Lorenza es una mujer emprendedora, enérgica y muy luchadora, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le ayuden a alcanzar sus metas su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y la perseverancia pues sabe que solo así lograra el éxito que tanto desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere ampliar el negocio pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, etc. Lorenza tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 61 years old, and she lives with her daughter.  She has a store where she sells basic needs products like rice, beans, eggs, milk, bread, and soap, among others.  She has had the business for several years, and this has gifted her with a lot of sales experience.  

This allows her to get better income.  Her business is located in an area where a lot of people live.  Most of her customers are her neighbors and the people who come to a nearby field for the week-end.  They prefer her because her store is the best stocked.  They always find what they need, a quality product at reasonable prices.  Above all, she provides excellent service.

Lorenza is an enterprising, energetic, and very tenacious woman.  She is always looking for ways to help meet her goals.  Her biggest secret is effort and perseverance.  She knows that this is the only way she will achieve the success she so desires.  

Like all good merchants, she wants to expand her business.  However, she needs capital to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy basic grains, candy, bread, instant products, and drinks, etc.  Lorenza has good payment references, and she affirms that she will be able to repay the debt.  At the same time, she has faith that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, bread, instant products, and drinks.

loans.name: Felicito

texts.es:
Don Felicito tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en las fincas como peón, aprendió junto con su abuelo ayudándole a realizar sus cultivos y posteriormente busco trabajo en las fincas de otros amigos. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, él tiene que caminar a pie unos treinta minutos, luego aborda un autobús que tarda otros treinta minutos, cuando compra los insumos paga a un vehiculo para trasladarlos hasta su casa, paga un dólar por quintal.

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una arroba de semilla de fríjol, un quintal de abono y foliares; pesticidas para su cultivo. Al comprar sus insumos, podrá aplicarlos a tiempo y obtener mejores resultados e ingresos por la venta de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Felicito, 40, is married and has three children.  He has worked in agriculture for 20 years.  He works as an agricultural worker on farms.  He learned this work with his grandfather, helping him with the crops.  Later he looked for work on the farms of other friends.

To buy the agricultural inputs he has to walk about 30 minutes, then take a bus for another 30 minutes.  When he buys the supplies, he pays a vehicle to transport them to his house.  He pays one dollar per quintal.

He will invest the loan in buying one "arroba" [unit of weight, 11-16 kilograms] of bean seed, one quintal of manure and foliar fertilizer, and pesticide for his crops.  Upon buying the inputs he'll be able to apply them on time and get better results and income for the sale of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells groundnuts at Batanya near Cape Coast, and she has been selling groundnut for 15 years now.  She is a single parent with five children, so she uses her income to feed, clothe and to pay her children’s school fees.  Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of groundnut to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of groundnut to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena lives together with her husband who is a farmer and their seven children at Batanya near Cape Coast. Abena is a fish monger; she buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it before selling it. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Abena wants to buy the fish in large quantities, so she needs a loan from Kiva to enable her to get the amount of fish she wants to smoke. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru:
Бактыгул 41 год, замужем. Бактыгул работает помощником повара в школе и в качестве дополнительного дохода с 2008  года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова с приплодом, 5 голов овец. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 15,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 41 years old and married. She works as an assistant cook in a school. 

Since 2008, Baktygul has been raising livestock as a means of supplementing her salary. She began this business with only 5,000 Kyrgystan Som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Baktygul's farm now has 1 dairy cow and calf, and 5 head of sheep. Her farm brings in a monthly income of 15,000 Som.

Baktygul approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kyrgystan Som for the purpose of developing her business. She will use these funds to purchase cattle for fattening. Baktygul plans to re-invest the profit generated by this loan into her business by further increasing her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agenes fries doughnuts to sell at Batanya near Cape Coast, which she has done for some time now. She is a widow with three children, so she is responsible for feeding, clothing  and paying her children's school fees. She uses her income for these expenses. Agenes needs this loan to enable her to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnuts. With the new profit, she will save to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals to sell

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru:
