Meliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: В ее лице можно увидеть национальную таджикскую женщину, которая является хранительницей  семейного очага. Ее зовут Зухро. Ей 42 года.  Зухро вдова и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она вышивает покрывало для детской колыбели, но ее доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Зухро  решила организовать новый бизнес скотоводством для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки коровы, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: In her face can be seen a national Tajik woman, who is a guardian of the family home.  Her name is Zuhro.  She is 42 years old, a widow and raising two children.  She embroiders blankets for children's cribs, but her income is not sufficient to provide the family with all of the necessities.  Zuhro decided to organize a new business in animal husbandry to improve her family's welfare.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women and obtained a certificate.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy a cow and start her new business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cow and start her new business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is married with 4 children. He is 55 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora. To earn a living, Ricardo operates a business venture planting and harvesting bananas to sell. He has been in business for 4 years. Each month he earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ricardo been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Ricardo hopes to expand his business to continue to meet daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Josephat  Mbau

texts.en:
Josephat is 47 years old and married with three children. He does electrical repair to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for 20 years and has employed one person. Josephat does farming to supplement his income. 

Josephat had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management skills. He dreams of employing more people in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy electronic accessories.

loans.use: To buy electronic accessories

loans.name: Cleyder

texts.es:
Cleyder es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus abuelos ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Pavón de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que es agente de ventas en una empresa privada y también realiza  todo tipo de trámites ya que es abogado y con lo que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El  crédito lo requiere para la refacción de la cocina de la casa de sus abuelos, pues se encuentra muy  deteriorada (comprará mosaico y azulejos para las paredes y el piso, más el costo de mano de obra).
El sueño de Cleyder es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Cleyder’s single and has no children.  She lives in her grandparents’ house occupying a single room.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Pavón zone.

She currently earns income working as a sales agent in a private firm and she also carries out a variety of transactions since she’s an attorney.  With what she earns she must cover food and basic utility costs.

She needs the loan to repair the kitchen in her grandparents’ house because it’s quite deteriorated.  She will buy tile to repair the walls and floor and will pay labor costs.

Cleyder’s dream is to improve her income so that she can become independent.  This is her first loan request to Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tile to repair her grandparents' kitchen floor and walls.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Rebecca runs a nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair) retail business in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell. She has been running the nipa retail business for 14 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. Rebecca aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna is 39 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school. Juna is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Juna requested a 12,000  PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. She has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Naomi  Kerubo

texts.en: Naomi is 37 years old and married with three children who are in school. Naomi makes and sells mandazis (doughnuts) for a living. She has engaged in this business for 5 years and has employed one person. Naomi operates a salon business to supplement her income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management skills. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan to buy wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 47 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosie has been farming rice for 27 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosie is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, viven en casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
El trabaja como técnico mecánico de automotores realizando todo tipo de trabajos por más de diez horas al día. También sigue con su negocio de reciclado de bolsas de plástico que compra de hospitales y mercados y luego de procesarlas las vende a las fábricas. Javier es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más bolsas al por mayor  para después reciclarlas y venderlas.
El sueño de Javier, es mejorar sus ingresos y vivir en una casa en anticrético para tener más comodidad 
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Javier is married and has two children who are now independent.  They live in his parents’ house occupying two rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.

He works as an auto mechanic doing all kinds of jobs for more than ten hours daily.  He also continues with his business recycling plastic bags that he buys in hospitals and markets to process and resell to factories.  Javier is the only one who covers family food and basic utility costs.

He needs the loan to buy more bags at wholesale to then recycle and sell.  Javier’s dream is to improve his income and to live in a house under the ‘anticrético modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to be more comfortable.  This is his fourth loan request to Impro and second to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of plastic bags for processing and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es: Luisa Fernanda de la edad de 20 años, estudiante de la carrera de psicología, sus padres le ayudan a pagar sus estudios universitarios, ella solicita crédito para el pago del curso de titulación de su carrera, de no ser posible este préstamo habría pospuesto entrar al curso de titulación y buscaría empleo para poder ahorrar y pagarlo hasta el próximo año. Le interesa mucho su profesión porque es parte de su desarrollo personal y los beneficios son el poder retribuir lo mucho que le han dado sus padres y ayudar a mejorar su calidad de vida. Nos comparte que AFODENIC y KIVA le ayudo a culminar con su educación, lo que le permite contribuir con el desarrollo del país.
texts.en:
Luisa Fernanda, 20 years old, is studying for a degree in psychology. Her parents are helping her pay her university expenses. She is requesting a loan to pay the final fees to register her degree. Were it not for this loan, she would have to postpone paying these fees and instead look for a job so she could save money and pay them next year.

She is very interested in her profession because it is part of her personal development and the benefits include being able to repay all that her parents have given her and helping to improve their quality of life. She shares that AFODENIC and KIVA helped her to finish her education, which enables her to contribute to her country’s development.

loans.use: to pay to register her degree.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira  es soltera y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes y uno que está en etapa escolar, vive cuidando una casa y ocupa solo dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja confeccionando ropa de ambos sexos, por más de diez horas al día ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar tela,hilo, forros y cierres por cantidad para la confección de sus prendas y posteriormente venderlas.
El sueño de Elvira, es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticrético para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la séptima vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elvira’s single and has three children; two of them are already independent and one is still school age.  She lives caretaking a house and occupies just two rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.

She earns income sewing clothes for both genders.  She works more than ten hours daily since she’s the only one who covers family food, education and basic utility costs.

She needs the loan to buy fabric, thread, lining and zippers in quantity to make clothes for subsequent sale.  Elvira’s dream is to improve her income in order to get a house under the ‘anticrético modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to be more comfortable and improve her quality of life.  This is the 7th loan request to Impro and 2nd to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, soap, and shampoo. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

In the future Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Vilma Morena

texts.es: Vilma Morena de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal cremas, lociones, desodorantes entre otros, además adicional a eso vende vestidos y camisas para complementar los gastos del hogar, comercia de forma ambulante y desde su vivienda, los años de trabajo le han regalado experiencia en las ventas y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio Vilma se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad; es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y luchadora, sabe que aunque le cueste alcanzar sus sueños al final después de tanto esfuerzo será mejor la recompensa, en los últimos meses tuvo perdidas en las ventas pero quiere recuperarse e invertir de nuevo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, lociones, desodorantes, vestidos, camisas, etc. Vilma Morena tiene buenas referencias de pago, es responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma Morena, 35, lives with her life companion and daughter in her own house.  She sells personal use products like creams, lotions and deodorant, among others and in addition sells dresses and shirts to earn more household income.  She sells from place to place and also from home.  She’s gained much experience during the years she’s worked and has acquired a good clientele who prefer her because of the quality, good prices and excellent service.  Vilma is noted for her great kindness; she’s a woman who is dedicated to her work, she’s energetic and tenacious.  She knows that even if it’s difficult, reaching her dreams after much effort will be the greatest reward.

She suffered some drops in sales the last few months and wants to recuperate and reinvest which is why she’s requesting a loan from Integral to buy creams, lotions, deodorants, dresses, shirts, etc.  Vilma Morena has good payment references, is responsible and is sure that she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time she has faith that she’ll be able to provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, dresses and shirts.

loans.name: Nidia Liz

texts.es: La socia es la señora Nidia, Ella continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de productos de artesanías principalmente en elementos tejidos y joyería, pero ahora también alterna esta actividad con el negocio del restaurante, ambas actividades ejecuta paralelamente. Nidia esta expandiendo sus actividades, puesto que el turismo tiene temporadas altas y bajas y por ello necesita de un ingreso económico adicional, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar utensilios y mobiliario como vajilla y muebles para su restaurante, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse ahora en ambas actividades, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Nidia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member, Nidia, continues with her business selling handicrafts, particularly textiles and jewelry.  Now she also alternates this work with a restaurant business.  She carries out both activities at the same time.  Nidia is expanding her work because tourism has high and low seasons, so she needs an additional income.

She's requesting the loan to buy utensils and furnishings such as dishes and furniture for her restaurant.

For this she's very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop now in both activities.  She promises to make her payments punctually.  Nidia belongs to Kukuli Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy utensils and furnishings for her restaurant

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El Señor Manuel  tiene 63 años de edad, reside en compañía de su esposa, 2 hijos y su nuera en el Municipio de Tela, Departamento de Atlántida.
Don Manuel  se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar a través de una pulpería la cual atiende junto con su esposa en su casa de habitación. Como actividad adicional Don Manuel vende tajaditas de plátano verde.
Decidió adquirir un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que utilizará para surtir con productos alimenticios que sus clientes le demandan como ser: harina, maseca, arroz, manteca, papel higiénico.
Don Manuel desea agrandar su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 63, lives with his wife, two children and daughter-in-law in the city of Tela, Atlántida Department.  He sells basic staple items in a grocery store he runs with his wife at home.  As an additional activity, Manuel also sells fried plantain slices.

He decided to take out a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy food items his customers demand like flour, Maseca, rice, lard and toilet paper.  He wants to enlarge the business to improve his income and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Hossana Group

texts.es:
“Inicie con la venta de pan, café y huevo, poco a poco he logrado aumentarlo con el crédito anterior mejore la infra estructura embaldose y puse verjas.” Dijo la señora Ana de 40 años, quien es coordinadora del grupo Hossana. Ella inicio con la pulpería hace 5 años la cual ha ido aumentando con este crédito invertirá en ropa.
Las otras integrantes son Socorro quien vende perfumes y zapatos desde hace 5 años y Patricia quien vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
Ana, 40, who is the coordinator of the “Hossana” group stated: “I started out selling bread, coffee and eggs and gradually have been able to grow.  I used the previous loan to improve the infrastructure installing tile and metal grilles.”  She opened her grocery store five years ago and has gradually expanded it.  She’ll invest this loan in clothes.

The other group members are Socorro who has sold perfume and shoes for five years and Patricia who sells used clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

Teresita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 49 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Amelita has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Amelita aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 45 years old and married with one child. Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 12 years and also earns income from food vending and raising livestock.

Analyn has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her store. Analyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Analyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Las Bomberas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las bomberas es un buen grupo que ya va en su 7° ciclo. Se llaman las Bomberas por que así se llama la calle donde empezó el grupo. 

Jhajaira Isabel es una joven integrante del grupo y a sus 22 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a sus dos hijas de 1 y 5 años de edad en el municipio de Monterrey, N.L.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y novedades por catalogo; comenzó vendiendo ropa y zapatos entre sus vecinos y gracias a Dios tuvo muy buena venta.

Para ella seria una gran meta el poder llegar a tener su propia boutique y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes también su mercancía por catalogo.
texts.en:
The “Las Bomberas” group is in its 7th cycle.  They are called “Las Bomberas” because that’s the name of the street where the group began.  

Jhajaira Isabel, 22, is a young group member.  She lives in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León, in a common law relationship and has two daughters who are 1 and 5 years of age.

She sells clothes, shoes and novelties via catalogue.  She started out selling clothes and shoes among her neighbors and thanks be to God had very good sales.  A great goal for her would be to own a boutique and to also sell catalogue merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to stock up on catalogue merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nelita has been in this business for 10 years. Nelita earns additional income from rice retail sales and a general store.

Nelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Victor  Bosire

texts.en: Victor is 29 years old and married with two children who are in school. He sells sugarcane to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for three years and has employed three people. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management skills. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming successful in the future. He has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy sugarcane to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugarcane.

loans.name: Deodora

texts.en:
Deodora works hard to support her family. Deodora is married and has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines.

Deodora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to sell.

Deodora has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Deodora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a ambulant vending tobacco business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
Ma. Luna works hard to support her family. Ma. Luna is married and has a nipa (woven palm matts used for house repair) retail business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Ma. Luna has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Ma. Luna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products (nipa) to sell.

loans.name: Myrna Janeth

texts.es: La Sra. Myrna Janet esta casada con el Sr. Jesús quien se desempeña como soldador en una empresa de Monterrey y sus ingresos son bajos. La Sra. Myrna consciente de que esos ingresos no le alcanzaban para lo indispensable, tomó la iniciativa de poner un puesto de venta de Tacos al vapor al lado de una escuela y ha tenido buenas ventas. Algo que le caracteriza al puesto de la Sra. Myrna es la limpieza e higiene, por lo que los clientes se sienten muy contentos en su pequeño negocio. La Sra. Myrna se siente muy feliz  por lo que ha logrado y con el crédito solicitado ha decido adquirir mesas y sillas para dar un mejor servicio  a sus clientes, además de que se incrementen sus ingresos para salir adelante junto con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Myrna Janet is married to Jesús, who works as a welder for a business in Monterrey making very little money. Myrna, who was aware of the financial needs of her family, took the initiative to start up her own taco stand next to a school, and her stand has done very well.

Myrna is an organized, clean person who places an emphasis on cleanliness and hygiene in her standards for her food business, and her customers are very happy with the results. Myrna is grateful for the opportunity of this loan, and plans to use the support to add tables and chairs to her business to accommodate more customers. She hopes that this investment will lead to increased sales, increased income, and will lead to a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to acquire tables and chairs for her business, and to increase her sales and profits to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: Maura es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una floristería desde hace años años. Este negocio lo inicio con una socia, actualmente trabaja sola e invertirá el crédito en la compra de flores, cintas, trípode, canastas, celofán y peluches….etc para realizar areglos florales.
texts.en: Maura is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has operated a flower shop for many years. She started the business with a partner, and now works on her own. She plans to use the support from this loan to buy flowers, ribbon, stands, baskets, cellophane, stuffed animals, etc, for making her floral arrangement and gift baskets.

loans.use: to buy flowers and ribbons.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Antonio is 26 years old, is single and lives with his parents and brothers who are his highest priority.  With his loan he aspires to purchase fertilizers and fungicide and to pay for assistance with the coffee.  Besides being able to buy some plants in seedling containers to replant them and thus increase the density of plants per area, he will also take advantage of the good fertility of the soil, climate conditions and other things that favor the cultivation of coffee.  With these improvements to the cultivation he hopes to obtain a little profit and thus improve the living conditions of his family, invest a little more in the cultivation area and also to be able to fulfill some goals.  It is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur.  He had not had other loans from state banks before but Fudecosur has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fungicide and pay for assistance with his coffee.

loans.name: Fidélité Group

texts.fr: FIDÉLITÉ est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Odette dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Odette est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Odette a peu fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de dix ans que Odette mène comme activité la vente des sacs et des chaussures. Odette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Odette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Odette sollicite un troisième crédit avec le second membre du groupe FIDÉLITÉ. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FIDÉLITÉ is a group made up of two members who are friends. 

The group's representative, Odette, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 34 years old, married to a reseller named Joseph, and the mother of four children, some of whom attend school.  Three of the children are still in their care. Odette and Joseph live with their children and jointly take care of the various needs of the household. Odette attended school for a short period of time.

Odette has been reselling bags and shoes for almost ten years now. She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin. 

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, Odette is requesting a third loan, along with the other member of the FIDÉLITÉ group. This loan will help them to better meet their customers' demand and to increase their profits.

Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags and shoes.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Julio, el socio continúa con su actividad económica que es la de cocinero en su propio restaurante, trabajando muy duro para sacarlo adelante y haciéndolo crecer cada vez más. Julio está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  mobiliario como mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para realizar mejoras en su local.
Julio está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica y en la educación de sus hijos para procurarse un mejor futuro. Julio tiene un sueño a futuro, y es la de poner otro restaurante y comenzar con una cadena de comida típica e internacional. Julio pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member is Julio, he continues on with his economic business, being the chef in his own restaurant. He works very hard to succeed continue growing.

Julio is asking for this loan so that he can buy furniture like tables, chairs and kitchen utensils to make improvements to his store.

Julio is very grateful to KIVA for helping him with his business and educating his children to provide them with a better future. 

Julio has a dream for the future, which is to have another restaurant and start a chain of international and local cuisine. 

Julio belongs to the communal bank "KUKULI" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy furniture like tables, chairs and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer con mucha ganas de salir adelante y brindarse una mejor calidad de vida. Es conviviente con Pablo quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos.  Juntos viven en una casa alquilada en compañía de una sobrina y su hermana. La actividad que tiene Susana es la venta de lubricantes de motos par eso cuenta con una tienda en un local alquilado. Todas sus mercaderías las traen desde la capital y las vende a precios competitivos logrando ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes quienes la recomiendan  con otras personas, logrando hacer crecer su clientela siendo su tienda muy concurrida.
Se inició hace más de 2 años por idea de su pareja y contando con un capital propio, contando con el apoyo de su pareja en la atención en sus tiempos libres.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos por los precios justos que oferta, además de haber un parque vehicular que va en aumento.
Antes de iniciar su negocio no contaba con ingresos propios, por eso decidió contar con un oficio y generarse sus propios ingresos económicos, de esa manera también apoyaría a su pareja en realizar sus planes de comprar su propia casa.Por tanto viendo los buenos resultados, desea en un futuro aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y ampliar con la venta de repuestos de motos. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP. Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias
Con  el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la comprar de lubricantes al por mayor así tendrá un stock disponible para la venta. Desea conseguir  precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen y contar con mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Susana is 34 years old. She is very eager to get ahead and achieve a better quality of life. She lives with Pablo, the father of her children, who is a merchant. They live together in a house they rent with one of their nieces and her sister. Susana's business sells motorcycle lubricants. She has a store set up in a space she rents. All of her merchandise is brought from the city and she sells it at competitive prices. She has been able to earn her customers' preference and they recommend her to other people, which increases her customer base and makes her store a very busy location.

She started out over two years ago. It was her partner's idea and she had her own capital, but he supported her by tending to the business in his time off.

She considers her business is quite profitable because there is high demand for her products, her prices are fair, and the total vehicle stock is on the rise as well. 

Before she started her business she didn't have her own income, wich is why she decided to find work and generate her own financial earnings. That would also allow her to help her partner realize their plans of buying a home. So in light of the positive results, in the future she would like to increase her amount of merchandise and expand by selling motorcycle spare parts. This is her 13th loan with the institution MFP, so she can count on their cooperation in order for her to carry out her plans. On the other hand, she once again promises to pay her installments as she did with previous loans. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very supportive people.

She will invest the requested amount of 1,500 nuevos soles in the purchase of wholesale lubricants so that she has stock available for sale. She wants to access better prices by purchasing in bulk so that she can achieve a higher profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle lubricants.

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es: La socia es la señora Hermenegilda, ahora con 39 años de edad y 3 hijos, continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes. Hermenegilda en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su comercio y comprar productos como arroz y azúcar por sacos, leche, fideos, aceite, bebidas y golosinas, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Hermenegilda pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda is 39 years old and has three children. She operates a general store, where she sells products for daily use. Hermenegilda is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her business and purchase products to stock her general store, such as: rice, sacks of sugar, milk, pasta, oil, drinks, sweets and other items.

She is grateful for this opportunity to further develop her business, and promises to make on time payments of monthly quotas. Hermenegilda is member of the community bank, "KUKULI," which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, pasta, oil, drinks, sweets and other items to stock her store.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 48 years old and married with three children.

Liberty works hard to provide for her family. She runs an electronic re-loading (pre-paid cell phone and money transfer credits) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional load to resell.

Liberty has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the electronic re-loading business for nine years and also earns an income as a telecommunication agent.

Liberty aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic load (pre-paid cell phone credits) to resell.

loans.name: Twunguke Ii Group

texts.fr:
Chantal  fait partie du groupe Twunguke II et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à Zedico, un commerçant de farine. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants  dont  2 étudient.

Elle fait  l’agriculture et le commerce de  farine  depuis  12 ans 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital  et acheter une grande quantité de farine à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Les gains de son commerce, en plus du revenu de l’agriculture font vivre la famille.
texts.en:
Chantal is a member of the Twunguke II group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 27 years old and married to Zedico, who sells flour.  They have four children, two of whom are in school.

Chantal has been producing and selling flour for 12 years.  

This is her tenth loan with Turame.  With the loan that she is receiving from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of flour for resale, in order to make more money.

Thanks to the profits from her business, and to the income she makes from farming (flour producing), Chantal is able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of flour for resale.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio tiene 44 años, y está casado, nos cuenta que se dedica a la compra de maderas en rollos, tiene motosierra con el cual asierra las maderas y las vende, realiza vigas, tirantes, postes y otros.
Es un señor muy trabajador y muy conocido de la zona, también se dedica a la agricultura, y por medio de estos trabajos ayuda a su familia y salen adelante. El desea cada día superarse y ser una mejor persona.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas, ya que es su fuente de trabajo y desea poder seguir invirtiendo en lo que le ayuda a mantener a su familia. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso que recibe
texts.en:
Ignacio is 44 years old and he is married. He has told us he engages in buying timber. He saws the timber with his chainsaw and then sells the wood; he also makes beams, crosspieces, poles and other items.
He is a very hardworking man and he is well-known in the area; he also engages in agriculture, and thanks to these activities he helps his family to progress in life. His daily goal is to excel and to improve as a person.
He is requesting a loan to buy timber, as this is the material he needs for his job and he wishes to continue investing in what helps him provide for his family. He is thankful for the chance to progress he has received.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 55 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Loreta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Loreta has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La  Señora Eugenia tiene 44 años de edad, reside en compañía de sus 6 hijos y su esposo en el Municipio de Arizona, Departamento de Atlántida.
Inicio su negocio de venta de alimentos y mercadería en general hace 12 años, ella vende granos básicos, café, azúcar, productos de aseo y limpieza, medicinas para enfermedades comunes.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los cuales piensa invertir  en la compra de productos alimenticios, así como en la compra de repuestos para bicicleta (neumáticos y llantas) y  productos de loza.
Doña Eugenia manifiesta que tomo el préstamo para capitalizarse y mejorar las ventas, lo cual repercutirá en el aumento de sus ganancias que destinara para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y mejoría en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 44 years old, and lives with her husband and six children in the municipality of Arizona, in Atlántida department. 

She started her business selling food and general merchandise 12 years ago. She sells staple grains, coffee, sugar, cleaning and hygiene products, and medicines for common ailments. 

Currently, she has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 lempiras, which she intends to invest in the purchase of food products, as well as bicycle parts (tubes and tires) and crockery.

Eugenia says that she took out the loan in order to have working capital and improve sales. This will result in increased earnings that she will earmark for helping her children with their education and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking her store, such as staple grains, medicines and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from livestock raising. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Myla Jane

texts.en:
Myla Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Myla Jane has been in this business for 10 years.

She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell at the shop. In the future, Myla Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Mylene runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF, to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mylene has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the charcoal retail for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending. Mylene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo trabaja unido desde hace dos años, gracias a su trabajo y lucha ya están en el octavo ciclo. Demuestran que con trabajo y dedicación se puede salir adelante. 
Una de ellas es la Sra. Miguela quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas y también tiene una cancha de vóley en su casa. La Sra. Miguela nos cuenta que gracias a su grupo y a la ayuda de la fundación está saliendo adelante y ha mejorado mucho.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of this group have been working together for ten years, and thanks to their job and their effort they are already working their eight cycle, thus showing it is possible to progress in life through hard work and dedication.
Miguela is one of the members: she engages in selling soft drinks and she also has a volleyball court in her yard. Miguela has told us that thanks to her group and to the foundation’s help she is progressing in life and her condition has greatly improved.
She is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks to supply her shop, thus keeping on serving her customers.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Jhon, el socio continúa con su actividad económica que es la comercialización de productos de artesanía, pero también y paralelamente sigue con el servicio de taxi, esto para ayudarse económicamente y percibir un ingreso monetario extra. Jhon está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como tapices tejidos y adornos en cerámica para su actividad comercial artesanal.
Jhon está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica y en la educación de sus hijos para procurarse un mejor futuro. Jhon pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: This member, John, continues to work in his business which is the sale of handicrafts, but at the same time has a taxi service.  The latter is to help himself economically and to earn extra income.  Jhon is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as woven carpets and ceramic decorations for his handicraft business.  Jhon is very grateful to KIVA for helping him with his business and with the education of his children in order to create a better future.  Jhon belongs to the "KUKULI" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as woven carpets and ceramic decorations.

loans.name: Ivanny Nohemy

texts.es:
Ivanny es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja, a quien ama y agradece todo el apoyo brindado, a pesar de ser tan joven ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar la carrera de Enfermería que dese, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Ivanny puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, tales como pollo broaster, salchipollos y otras frituras, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón, dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Ivanny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mesa, sillas, cubiertos y servicios descartables para su negocio; de esta manera Ivanny tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado, con ello espera poder brindar mayor comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, así ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco ahorrará para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y así desea logar su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ivanny is a young person of 19 years of age who lives in the city of Pisco with her partner, who she loves and is grateful to for his support. In spite of her youth, she is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because she needed to work, she has been unable to study to be a nurse as she wished, but she would really like to do so. In her free time, she likes to play sport and occasionally to cook a delicious rice and duck dish to share with her family.

With lots of effort, enthusiasm and thanks to the help of her mother, Ivanny has set up a small business selling food, such as fried chicken and other fried goods. She gets up early every day to start work and can work for around 12 hours a day. She believes it is going well because of her good seasoning, dedication and the friendly manner she offers her customers.

Ivanny is very grateful to the Kiva loan givers, as thanks to the help offered she will be able to buy a table, chairs, cupboards and disposable napkins for her business. In this way, Ivanny hopes her business will be better suited and that she will be able to offer improved comfort and better service to her customers. She hopes that in this way she will be able to increase her sales and income so that little by little she can save so that in the not to distant future she can grow her business and achieve her dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs, cupboards and disposable napkins.

loans.name: Norva

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norva works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store and from farming vegetables.

Norva is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her fish vending business. Norva has obtained one loan from NWTF in the past, to help sustain her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from meat vending. Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell for her vegetables and spices vending business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 42-year-old widow with five children. She has been in the cereal-selling business for the last five years while earning approximately KES 10,000 monthly. This is Annah’s second loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loan. 

She borrowed KES 20,000 and plans to use it for purchasing dry maize and beans to sell. With the anticipated profits, she plans to repay her loan and use the remaining amount for maintaining her business.

She hopes to take care of her children’s needs and education.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Sara Victoria

texts.es: Sara Victoria de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto  a su familia, ella posee una pupusería comercia pupusas revueltas, de queso, frijol con queso entre otras, tiene varios años con el negocio y es muy conocida en la localidad, pues sus pupusas son las mas exquisitas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija, la prefieren porque todo esta elaborado con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Sara es una mujer activa, muy dedicada a su trabajo, le gusta luchar por lo que desea, día a día tiene la esperanza de ganarse un futuro mas prospero por eso se esfuerza al máximo, no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles, verduras, etc. Sara Victoria tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, se responsabiliza de cancelar la deuda y a la vez confía que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Sara Victoria, 31, lives with her family.  She has a pupusa shop where she sells pupusas of mixed ingredients, of cheese, and of bean and cheese, among others.  She has had the business for several years and is very well known in the town because her pupusas are so delicious.  She has gotten many regular customers, who prefer her because everything is made with high-quality ingredients at affordable prices and with unparalleled customer service.

Sara's an active woman who is very devoted to her work.  She likes to fight for what she wants.  Every day she hopes for a more prosperous future, so she makes the maximum effort.  She doesn't plan to give up until she is successful.

Demand has gone up in the past weeks and she wants to take advantage of that to make a new investment.  That's why she's requesting a loan from Integral to buy corn, cheese, cracklings, beans, vegetables, etc.

Sara Victoria has a good payment record and impeccable morals.  She assumes responsibility for paying off the debt and, at the same time, is confident that she'll be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, cracklings, beans, and vegetables

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Emprendedoras De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres emprendedoras de Villa Nueva.
Mayte es casada tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica a ser cultora de belleza inicio su negocio hace 10 años eso cuando recibió un curso de belleza, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosméticos para su negocio, también parte del crédito lo utilizará para la compra de una silla para el corte de cabello, ya que su trabajo lo realiza a domicilio ya no cuenta con el equipo necesario, ella espera que con el crédito podrá atender en su casa y tener un área solo para su salón de belleza, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Enterprising Women of Villa Nueva Duo.

Mayte is married and has two children.  She’s been a hair stylist for ten years; she opened her business when she completed a beauty course.  She’s requesting this loan to buy cosmetics for her business and also will use part of the loan to buy a salon chair to do haircuts because she’s been providing services at customers’ houses so she does not have the necessary equipment and she hopes the loan will help her be able to provide the services at home and to set aside space exclusively for her beauty salon; she hopes you will be able to help her with the loan she’s requested.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a beauty salon chair.

loans.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Juan Raul, el socio continúa con su actividad económica que es la comercialización de elementos de artesanía como ropa tejida en fibra de alpaca, joyería  y también adornos en cerámica. Juan Raul está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como tejidos, joyas en plata y adornos en cerámica para su actividad comercial artesanal.
Juan Raul está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica, y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. El pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Juan Raúl continues with his economic activity selling crafts like alpaca wool clothes and ceramic decorations.  Juan Raúl is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like textiles, silver jewelry and ceramic decorations for his crafts business.  

Juan Raúl is very grateful to Kiva for helping him with his economic activity and commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He belongs to the “Kukuli” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy textiles, silver jewelry and ceramic decorations.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Con un prestamo de 51,750 pesos Santa ha podido comprar ropa y perfumes para renovar el inventario de su tienda.
Santa inició este negocio hace 7 años, a raiz de su divorcio. Hasta entonce sólo había sido ama de casa y no se imaginaba trabajando en una oficina. Como es muy buena conversadora y se le hace fácil hacer amigos, pensó en usar este talento para vender ropa y perfumes tanto a sus amigos como en las oficinas donde estos trabajan.
Santa va a las oficinas y lleva su mercancía donde la vende a crédito para ser pagadas en dos o tres cuotas quincenales.
Santa tiene tres hijos, todos son adultos trabajan y estudian en la universidad.
El deseo de Santa es que su negocio se fortalezca y que cada día sea sostenible, ya que este es el unico medio de sustento que tiene.
texts.en:
With a loan of 51,750 pesos Santa has been able to buy clothes and perfumes and to renovate her shop's inventory.

Santa started this business 7 years ago because of her divorce. Until then she was just a housewife and never imagined herself working in an office.

As she is a very good conversationalist finds it easy to make friends, she thought she could use this talent to sell clothes and perfumes to her friends and in the offices where they work. 

Santa goes to the offices with her merchandise and sells products on credits to be paid in two or three fortnightly payments.

Santa has three children, they are all adults who work and study at university.

Santa wants her business to strengthen and to be sustainable, as this is the only method of earning that she has.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes and to renovate her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Carine Barbare

texts.fr: carine est une jeune femme de 30 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant de 9 ans qui va à l'école. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis 4 ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail et elle a aussi besoin d'un deuxième casque pour être plus rapide dans l’accomplissement de ses taches. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter les mèches, défrisants et produits cosmétiques. Ceci lui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Carine is a young single woman, age 30, and the mother of a 9-year-old child who goes to school.

After her training, she opened a hairdressing salon which she has been managing for the past four years.  Her recurrent problem is that her beauty salon lacks cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves, because she can only buy in retail quantities.  Carine also needs a second helmet hair dryer, in order to be more efficient in her tasks.  Her goal is to satisfy her customers' needs and to make more profits.

She is requesting a loan to buy hair extensions, hair-straightening products and cosmetics.  This will help her to reach her goals.

Profits from this loan will help Carine to meet her needs and those of her family.  With her profits, she will also be able to save some money to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetic and hair-straightening products.

loans.name: Muñequitas Group

texts.es:
Muñequitas es un grupo muy trabajador que ya tiene 4 ciclos con la empresa. El nombre de muñequitas se les ocurrió a ellas y a su antiguo asesor.

Dalila Eunice es una joven y emprendedora mujer y se dedica a la venta de aparatos electrodomésticos, novedades y productos americanos en mercados rodantes desde hace 8 años. Ella es casada y vive en el municipio de Monterrey junto a sus dos hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar.

Dalila nos cuenta que su esposo se dedica a vender autos que trae de E. U. en un tianguis y que el crédito le ayudara a ella para traer cosas de temporada navideña.

Dalila desea seguir vendiendo su mercancía en mercados rodantes, ya que le va muy bien, para en un futuro poder darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Muñequitas is a hardworking group that has already had 4 cycles with the business. They came up with the name Muñequitas  with their former advisor.

Dalila Eunice is a young and enterprising women who has been selling domestic appliances, novelty items and american products in the travelling markets for 8 years. She is married and lives in the town of Monterrey with her two children, aged 4 and 8, who are both in education.

Dalila tells us that her husband sells cars a market that he brings from the US and that the loan will help her to bring things for the Christmas season. 

She wants to continue selling her merchandise in the travelling markets, as it is going well, so that in the future she can give her children a better life,

loans.use: to stock things for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Bella

texts.es:
Bella, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir advente y apoyar a su familia. Es conviviente con Luís quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos, que en total son 4, por quienes se esfuerza por brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Viven juntos en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Bella es la venta de pescado fresco, empezando muy de temprano cuando se dirige al puerto de pescadores a comprar su mercadería para venderlo en su puesto del mercado de la ciudad, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes, sabe que así se ganará sus preferencias y le seguirán comprando.
Se inició hace más de 8 años con un capital propio, el cual invirtió comprando en pequeñas cantidades, luego  viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio fue aumentando sus ventas.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene éste producto, sobre todo en tiempo se escasez donde aumenta sus precios.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea mantener su negocio y continuarlo pues es su única fuente de ingresos. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP. Por tanto, cuenta con un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y colaborador.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su mercadería principal, que es el pescado fresco, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, para así obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Bella, forty years old, is a woman with a great desire to get ahead and to support her family.  She lives with Luis who is a tradesman and the father of her four children, for whom she strives to provide a better quality of life.  They live together in their own house, which they bought with a great deal of effort.  Bella works selling fresh fish, starting very early when she goes to the fishermen's port to buy her merchandise to sell at her stall in the city market.  She serves her customers very amiably, as she knows that this way they will choose to keep doing business with her. She began more than 8 years ago with her own capital, which she invested in buying in small quantities.  Later, seeing that her business received a good reception, she increased her sales.  She considers her business to be quite profitable due to the good earnings that it brings her and the demand for the product, especially in times of scarcity when she increases her prices.  She decided to start her business because she needed to help her partner with the household expenses and pay for her children's studies.  Now, however, given the good results it has had, she wants to maintain and continue the business as it is her only source of income.  This is her 13the loan with the MFP organization.  She is requesting a small loan in order to achieve her objectives.  On the other hand, she comments that she likes working with her communal bank because she considers it to be united and collaborative.
With the amount requested of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying her principal merchandise, which is fresh fish, searching for the best prices for her purchases in volume, so as to obtain the best profit margins.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, además de  decidida. Es conviviente con Juan quien es empleado y padre de sus 2 hijos.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus  hijos a los que adora y son el motivo de querer  progresar, habitando su casa propia, la cual logró construir en conjunto con su pareja. La actividad que realiza Eloisa  es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña bodega, que logró acondicionar en su propia casa, viendo las necesidades de sus vecinos, además de generarse un ingreso económico propio, la motivaron a abrir su bodega.
Lleva funcionando hace más de 07  años, tiempo que le sirvió para hacerse conocida entre sus vecinos y ganarse así una regular clientela, contando con la ayuda ocasional de sus hijos en la atención al público, pues generalmente atiende sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la ganancias que le deja, pues mantiene una regular clientela que siempre le compran sus productos.
Le gusta su actividad  al poder estar  en casa  y atender a sus hijos, además del tiempo libre que le deja y la dedica al cuidado de su hogar, también le gusta el ingreso económico que le genera, con el cual poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. 
Por tanto, tiene planes de  hacer incrementar el stock de sus productos y diversificar su variedad para así tener más acogida entre sus clientes. Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad brindada de  contar con un capital de trabajo, desea seguir contando con éste apoyo, para lo cual, se compromete a ser puntual en sus  pagos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan mutuamente. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará  más variedad de abarrotes como conservas, leches en polvo, aceites, arroz, entre otros. Buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa podrá ser más competitivo en relación a precios.
texts.en:
Eloisa, 60, is an enterprising, very hardworking woman in addition to being very determined.  She lives with Juan who is employed and the father of their two children.  She lives in her own house with him and her children who she adores and the reason why she wants to make progress.  She was able to build her house together with her spouse.  

Eloisa’s activity is selling groceries in general and has a small store at home to do so.   Noting her neighbors’ needs and also wanting to earn her own income were the motivating factors that led to her opening her store.  She’s been in business for more than seven years which has been time enough to become well-known among her neighbors and to win over a regular clientele.  Her children sometimes help her tend to the public but she usually works alone.  She considers the store to be profitable because of the profits it nets since she has a regular clientele that always buy her products.  

She enjoys her work and being able to stay home to care for her children.  Besides, the free time it gives her she can spend caring for her home.  She also likes the income it generates that she can use to help her husband cover household expenses with.

Because of this, she has plans to increase stock of merchandise and diversify the variety so that she can be even better received by her customers.  This is MFP loan #3 and she feels happy with the opportunity being provided to have working capital.  She wants to continue to count on this help so commits to be punctual with her payments.  Also, she’s comfortable in her communal bank because of the mutual support they give each other. 

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy a wider variety of goods like canned goods, powdered milk, oil and rice, among others looking for the lowest prices attached to volume purchases.  In this way she will be able to be more competitive with her prices.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, powdered milk, oil and rice.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: La socia es la señora Rita, ella continúa con su actividad comercial artesanal, en la producción y venta de pinturas al oleo. Rita en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como pinturas, tela para lienzos, pinceles y marquetería, para la elaboración de sus lienzos artisticos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y con la educación de sus hijos, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Rita pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Rita continues her craft work, creating and selling oil paintings. She is currently requesting a loan to buy materials including paint, canvas clothes, brushes,and marquetry in order to create her paintings. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her work and improve her children's educations. She promises to make her payments on time. Rita belongs to the Kukuli communal bank, which is in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials including paint, canvas clothes, brushes, and marquetry

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Virginia has been in this business for 30 years. Virginia earns additional income from her general store.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 44 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Elna is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Elna has been buying and selling livestock for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a 43-year-old and married with 5 children who are in school. Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, eggs, etc.

In the future, Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 36-year-old single business woman. She runs a salon business and has been in operation for seven years earning KES 9,000 monthly.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD of KES 30,000 and she plans to use it to purchase weaves, braids, relaxers and hair oil for resale.

With the anticipated profits she plans to open another salon. Her hope and dreams is that her business prospers so she can earn more profits and open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Isnaida

texts.en:
Isnaida is 26 years old and married with one child.

Isnaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Isnaida has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from charcoal and vegetable retail sales.

Isnaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 63 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial en su trato con las personas. Está casada con Máximo quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Julia es la comercialización de abarrotes, artículos de librería, medicamentos y otros, para esto abrió una pequeña bodega en su propia casa, desde donde atiende las necesidades de sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes, a los que atiende muy amablemente. También vende golosinas y bebidas gasificadas en su bodega.
Se inició hace más de 8 años logrando hacerse muy conocida por las zonas que oferta sus productos y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera su negocio rentable porque casi siempre acaba todo lo que lleva para vender, dejándole buenas ganancias. Antes de empezar con su negocio tenía dificultades económicas ya que los alimentos suben  de precios constantemente y los ingresos de su esposo no les alcanzaban para cubrir todos sus gastos, por eso quiso apoyarlo generándose sus propios ingresos económicos.
Por tanto, viendo lo bien que le resulta su negocio, desea continuar y mantenerlo. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta con  un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. También comenta que se siente a gusto con banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio comprando abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceites, entre otros, y golosinas, buscando aumentar su capital con las ganancias de las ventas, por eso espera conseguir precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Julia, 63, is a hardworking, enterprising woman besides being cheerful and treating others kindly.  She’s married to Máximo who is a merchant and the father of their children who are all independent adults now.  They all live comfortably in their own house.  
 
Julia’s activity is selling groceries, stationery supplies, medicine and others.  To do so, she opened a small home-based store where she tends to her neighbors’ needs who are her main customers and who she tends to kindly.  She also sells sweets and carbonated beverages in her store.  She started more than 8 years ago and has succeeded in making herself very well-known in the areas because of her product offerings; to date she’s been working alone.

She considers her business to be profitable because she almost always sells out everything she brings to sell earning good profits.  Before starting her business she had economic difficulties because the price of food constantly rises and her husband’s income was insufficient to cover all expenses and that’s why she wanted to help him by earning income of her own.

Because of this, seeing the good results her business has, she wants to continue and keep it in operation.  This will be MFP loan #13 so she now has a small loan to be able to reach her objectives.  She commits once more to make her installment payments like she’s done with her previous loans.  She also comments that she feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers it to be a united, supportive group.

She will use the requested 1200 new soles to invest in her business buying groceries in general like rice, sugar and oil, among others and also sweets hoping to increase her capital though profits from sales.  She therefore hopes to get good prices because of her volume purchases.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and sweets, among others.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retail. Emma is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through the past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 36 years old and married with two children.

Marisol works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Marisol has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retail and food vending.

Marisol aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buying and selling of rice grains business.

Rosalia has been in this business for 15 years. Rosalia earns more income from general store.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Charito is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 41 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. Evalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Evalyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, snack foods, soap, etc.

In the future, Evalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
